item.title: Janus, BlackRock Among Managers to Lose Dutch Credit Mandates
item.description: BlackRock Inc. is among a group of money managers to have lost credit mandates from one of Europe’s largest pension funds, according to people familiar with the matter.

item.title: BlackRock Says Fiscal Angst in Global Bond Markets Is Overblown
item.description: Rising yields in global government bond markets reflect expectations that interest rates will remain higher, rather than concern over brewing fiscal crises, according to BlackRock Inc.

item.title: US Housing Market Is 'Stuck,' BlackRock's Rieder Says
item.description: “We need to bring down housing costs,” Rick Rieder, chief investment officer of global fixed income at BlackRock, says during an interview on “Bloomberg The Open.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: US Housing Market Is 'Stuck,' BlackRock's Rieder Says
item.description: “We need to bring down housing costs,” Rick Rieder, chief investment officer of global fixed income at BlackRock, says during an interview on “Bloomberg The Open.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: BlackRock’s Akaysha Gets A$300 Million to Grow Battery Fleet
item.description: BlackRock Inc.-owned Australia battery maker Akaysha Energy Pty. has raised A$300 million ($196 million) in debt to expand its global battery fleet, according to a company statement.

item.title: BlackRock Favors Indonesia Long Bonds, Unfazed by Protests
item.description: BlackRock Inc. remains a fan of long-dated Indonesian government bonds, saying the high-yield debt offers enough risk compensation in the face of local political instability.

item.title: BlackRock Readies Venture Secondaries Fund as Market Expands
item.description: BlackRock Inc. is preparing to roll out a new fund that will buy discounted venture capital stakes from other investors, expanding its push into a hot market.

item.title: BlackRock’s GIP Leads $11 Billion Deal for Saudi Gas Assets

item.title: European Earnings Are Pricing in Tariff Risks, Says BlackRock’s Jewell
item.description: The outlook for European earnings is appropriately reflecting tariff risks, according to BlackRock Inc.’s Helen Jewell, who sees the rally extending in the absence of a trade shock.
